title: JavaScript Certification - Domain 3
instructions: Read each question carefully. These questions test logical understanding of decision making and loops.

questions.text: A program checks whether a user is eligible for a discount by verifying that the age is greater than 18 and the membership status is true. Which logical operator should be used to ensure both conditions must be satisfied?
If a for loop is written with an incorrect condition that never becomes false, what will be the most likely outcome during program execution?
A developer wants to execute a block of code at least once, even if the condition is initially false. Which loop structure best fulfills this requirement?
When comparing two variables for both value and type inside an if condition, which comparison operator should be used to avoid unexpected type conversion?
In a switch statement, what is the logical consequence of forgetting to include the break statement at the end of a matching case?
options: Execution falls through to the next case

questions.text: A loop iterates through values from 1 to 10, but skips printing the value 5. Which loop control statement is most appropriate for this behavior?
Which loop is generally preferred when the number of iterations is known before the loop starts executing?
If a condition inside a while loop always evaluates to true and no break statement is used, what will be the effect on program execution?
A program uses nested if statements to evaluate multiple related conditions. What is the primary advantage of nested if structures?
Which logical operator is best used when a program must execute code if either one of two conditions is true?
In loop-based logic, what is the primary role of the loop counter variable?
A switch statement is most suitable in which of the following scenarios?
Which decision structure allows checking conditions in a sequential order until one condition evaluates to true?
Which operator is commonly used in loop conditions to ensure a value stays within a specific numeric range?
If a break statement is placed inside a loop, what is its immediate effect when executed?
Which loop structure checks its condition before executing the loop body for the first time?
A developer wants to repeatedly ask for user input until a valid value is entered. Which loop type is most suitable?
Which comparison operator ensures that two values are not equal in both value and type?
In complex loop logic, why is the continue statement preferred over break in some cases?
Which condition will correctly check that a number is greater than 10 but less than or equal to 50?
Which structure is best suited for implementing a grading system based on exact marks?
Which logical operator reverses the result of a boolean condition inside decision making?
What happens if the loop condition is false at the beginning of a do while loop?
Which loop is most commonly used for iterating over a known range of numeric values?
In decision making, which operator is used to compare whether one value is greater than another?
Which scenario can most easily lead to an infinite loop if not handled properly?
Why are logical operators often combined with comparison operators in loop conditions?
Which control structure allows repeating a block of code while a condition remains true?
Which statement is best used to immediately stop checking further conditions inside a loop or switch?
In exam-oriented logic questions, which mistake most commonly causes unexpected loop behavior?
